title: HydraAI Inspect: AI Vehicle Inspection on Hydra L2
summary: Vehicle inspection records are siloed, forgeable, and lack global standards. High-volume inspection workflows are too costly for L1, making industrial-scale blockchain adoption impossible.
solution: AI-powered vehicle inspection using Hydra L2 for instant, low-cost updates. Generates verifiable CIP-68 Vehicle Condition Tokens on Cardano, enabling industrial-scale trusted inspections.

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
HydraAI Inspect introduces a novel combination of AI computer vision, Hydra L2 batching, and CIP-68 tokenization to create verifiable, tamper-proof vehicle inspection records.

Ecosystem Research & Value Proposition

Research Conducted:

We analyzed all Catalyst-funded projects related to vehicle inspection, Hydra applications, and AI+blockchain integrations.

Findings:

- CAR-dano (Indonesia CAR-dano: An Immutable History Record System for Pre-Owned Automotive Transactions in Indonesia - Fund 13): Our previous project - basic L1 inspection records, no AI, no Hydra
- Hydra Projects: Mostly payment/gaming prototypes, no industrial workflows
- NFT Projects: Focus on art/collectibles, not industrial use cases

Value Proposition:

HydraAI Inspect is the first to combine AI computer vision + Hydra L2 + CIP-68 for industrial inspection. No existing Catalyst project addresses high-throughput, AI-assisted, verifiable inspection on Hydra.

Innovation highlights:

- First Hydra-powered industrial inspection workflowWhile past Catalyst projects have explored NFTs and data storage, none have combined AI inspection data with Hydra-based fast settlement to create a scalable inspection framework. This is the first real-world industrial use case for Hydra on Cardano.
- AI-assisted condition verificationDamage detection and scoring via AI reduces subjective variance and inspection fraud, creating objective, verifiable condition reports.
- CIP-68 Vehicle Condition Token (VCT)Each inspection mints an updatable NFT representing the vehicle's condition—creating a global, verifiable inspection format. CIP-68 enables the token to evolve as the car's condition changes or is repaired, maintaining a complete lifecycle history.
- Hydra as the operational engineInspection workflows involve many intermediate steps. Hydra enables:
    - Batching of high-volume updates (99% cost reduction)
    - Near-instant confirmations (sub-second vs minutes on L1)
    - Reduced cost (batch 100 updates, pay once)
    - Selective settlement to L1 (only final state committed)
- Developer-friendly open-source referenceThe project delivers both a working prototype and a reusable blueprint for AI+Hydra+tokenization applications. This blueprint is highly modular and easily adaptable for various other use cases: property inspection, electronics grading, logistics verification, etc.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
The MVP will include:



* AI Damage Detection Service  

  * User uploads car images  

  * AI model outputs damage classification and severity  

* Hydra-based Inspection Workflow  

  * Initiate inspection session in a Hydra Head  

  * Store intermediate AI results  

  * Update inspection metadata  

  * Approve inspection by multiple parties (inspector, dealership)  

* CIP-68 Vehicle Condition Token  

  * Minting of a VCT  

  * Metadata includes condition score, detected issues, timestamps  

  * Token stored on Cardano testnet  

* Prototype UI  

  * Upload photos  

  * View AI results  

  * View minted token link  

  * QR code viewer for VCT  

* Testnet deployment  

  * Hydra head instance accessible through public endpoint  

  * Public demo instructions via GitHub



Users and reviewers can interact with the MVP through a web demo and inspect the workflow via testnet explorer.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
* On-chain Metrics  

  * ≥50 real car inspections processed through the system  

  * 300+ simulated/testnet transactions demonstrating Hydra throughput  

  * 300+ CIP-68 VCT tokens minted on Cardano testnet  

  * 1,000+ Hydra transactions processed in Hydra Heads  

  * ≥50 settlement operations committed to Cardano L1  



* Public testnet deployment fully functional  

  * Video demo showcasing end-to-end workflow  

  * Public GitHub repository with comprehensive documentation  

  * Accessible landing page and web app for community testing  



* Qualitative Metrics  

  * Community developer feedback and engagement  

  * Number of forks/stars on GitHub repository  

  * Number of Hydra builders referencing the open-source code  



* Adoption Metrics  

  * At least 3 workshops or demos with the Cardano community  

  * 50+ users testing the platform during open beta

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
This proposal builds directly upon the success of a previous Catalyst-funded project, CAR-dano, developed by Sumbu Labs in collaboration with PT. Inspeksi Mobil Jogja (Palapa) and currently deployed at cari.inspeksimobil.id. The system is actively used in three inspection branches, processing approximately 15 vehicle inspections per day, and has demonstrated a measurable operational improvement of up to 50% in inspection workflow efficiency.

The platform is already being used in real commercial environments to generate immutable inspection records on Cardano, proving both market demand and technical feasibility. HydraAI Inspect represents the next evolution of this deployed solution by introducing AI-assisted inspection scoring and Hydra-based batching to scale the system for higher throughput and broader industry adoption.

Because the foundational infrastructure, partner network, and operational workflows are already established, this proposal carries significantly reduced delivery risk and a clear path to real-world adoption beyond prototype stage, enabling reuse in other automotive companies and adaptable AI models for non-vehicle inspection domains.

HydraAI Inspect is a decentralized vehicle inspection pipeline powered by Hydra. The system combines AI-generated damage analysis with secure tokenization, enabling trusted vehicle condition records that can be independently verified anywhere in the world.

Workflow:

1. User or inspector uploads vehicle photos
2. AI model detects damage (scratches, dents, bumper issues, paint defects, etc.)
3. Hydra processes inspection session updates (fast, off-chain)
4. Once confirmed, inspection metadata is finalized
5. A Vehicle Condition Token (VCT) is minted on Cardano using CIP-68
6. Users receive a QR code linking to the token metadata
7. Settlement to Cardano L1 ensures long-term immutability

Hydra makes this workflow scalable, low-cost, and instant, allowing industrial-grade inspection operations.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
The project is not starting from zero—deployment pipelines, inspection workflow, and industry partnerships already exist. This dramatically increases the likelihood of adoption and meaningful on-chain activity.



HydraAI Inspect contributes significantly to Cardano by:



A. Proving Hydra is Ready for Business



This serves as a live, commercial case study demonstrating Hydra's capability to handle real-world industrial throughput. It answers the critical question: "Can Hydra scale real applications?" with concrete proof.



B. Enabling New Developers



The open-source blueprint becomes a valuable learning tool for:

* Hydra beginners seeking production-ready examples  

* AI integration builders exploring blockchain use cases  

* NFT metadata engineers implementing CIP-68  

* Automotive/Web3 innovators building inspection systems  

* Any developer needing a reusable AI+Hydra+tokenization framework  



C. Real On-chain Activity



The project will generate consistent, meaningful transaction volume through:

* VCT minting (300+ tokens)  

* Metadata updates (1,000+ Hydra transactions)  

* Settlement transactions (50+ L1 commits)  

* Multi-party approvals (inspector + dealership signatures)  



D. Bridging AI and Cardano



This project demonstrates how Cardano can serve as a trusted ledger for AI-generated data, promoting future AI+blockchain solutions across industries (insurance, logistics, quality control, etc.).



E. Academic Validation



With 2 blockchain experts from Universitas Gadjah Mada's Faculty of Engineering, the project gains academic credibility and research validation, strengthening Cardano's reputation in Indonesian higher education.

sub_fields.title: Project Milestones
sub_fields.description: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?

sub_fields.title: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?
sub_fields.description: The number of milestones required depends on the amount of funding requested. Please refer to the Guidance card on the right for details

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Architecture & AI Integration

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: This milestone delivers the foundational architecture and AI integration components. The system architecture document will detail the complete technical stack including frontend (web/mobile), backend API services, AI inference pipeline, Hydra Layer 2 integration, and Cardano L1 settlement layer. The AI damage detection model will be integrated using YOLOv11n, trained to recognize common vehicle damage types including scratches, dents, paint defects, bumper damage, and windshield cracks. Backend skeleton repositories will be established with proper project structure, dependency management, and initial API endpoints for inspection management.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: The AI model must successfully detect and classify at least 5 distinct types of vehicle damage with minimum 80% confidence score on test images. The system architecture documentation must comprehensively cover all major components: Hydra Head setup for off-chain processing, backend services architecture (.NET/TypeScript/Go), AI service integration (Python FastAPI), CIP-68 token minting workflow, and data flow between components. A working Jupyter Notebook or Google Colab demonstration must be provided showing the AI model processing sample vehicle images and outputting damage classifications with bounding boxes and severity scores.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Public GitHub repository containing system architecture diagrams (high-level and component-level), AI model integration code with inference examples, backend API skeleton with initial endpoints, comprehensive README documentation explaining the architecture decisions, and Jupyter Notebook demonstrating AI damage detection on at least 10 sample vehicle images with visible results.

sub_fields.title: Delivery Month
sub_fields.description: The month when this milestone will be delivered

sub_fields.title: Cost
sub_fields.description: The cost of this milestone in ADA

sub_fields.title: Progress
sub_fields.description: Current status of the milestone

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Hydra Head Setup

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: A fully functional Hydra devnet environment will be deployed and configured for inspection session processing. This includes Hydra Head node setup with proper participant configuration (inspector, dealership, system), initialization scripts for Head lifecycle management, and integration with the backend inspection service. The Hydra workflow implementation will handle session creation for new inspections, state updates during the inspection process, multi-party approval mechanisms, and session closure with settlement to Cardano L1. Documentation will cover Hydra Head operational procedures, troubleshooting guides, and performance benchmarks.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: The Hydra infrastructure must demonstrate complete lifecycle management: successfully opening a Hydra Head with multiple participants, processing inspection state updates with sub-second confirmation times, handling multi-signature approvals from inspector and dealership parties, and closing the Head with proper settlement to Cardano testnet. Comprehensive unit tests must cover all Hydra operations including error handling, rollback scenarios, and concurrent session management. A video demonstration or detailed screenshot documentation must show the complete process of opening a Hydra Head, submitting transactions, and closing with L1 settlement, including visible node logs confirming successful operations.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Hydra node logs showing successful Head initialization and closure, bash/shell scripts for automated Hydra operations, public documentation with step-by-step instructions for running Hydra devnet, unit test results with >80% code coverage, and video demonstration or annotated screenshots showing the complete Hydra Head lifecycle from initialization through settlement.

sub_fields.title: Delivery Month
sub_fields.description: The month when this milestone will be delivered

sub_fields.title: Cost
sub_fields.description: The cost of this milestone in ADA

sub_fields.title: Progress
sub_fields.description: Current status of the milestone

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: CIP-68 Vehicle Condition Token (VCT)

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Implementation of the CIP-68 Vehicle Condition Token (VCT) standard with a comprehensive metadata schema that captures vehicle information, inspection results, AI-detected damage classifications, severity scores, and timestamps. The token minting pipeline will integrate with the Hydra settlement process to create NFTs on Cardano testnet after inspection approval. The metadata format will support updatable fields to allow for future re-inspections or condition changes while maintaining immutable historical records. Settlement pipeline to L1 will handle batch processing of multiple inspections, optimizing transaction costs while ensuring data integrity and proper CIP-68 reference token structure.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: Successful minting of Vehicle Condition Tokens on Cardano testnet following CIP-68 standard specifications with proper reference token and user token structure. Token metadata must include complete AI analysis results (damage types, severity, confidence scores, bounding box coordinates), vehicle identification (model, license plate, VIN), inspection timestamp, inspector ID, and IPFS links to inspection images. The implementation must support metadata updates for re-inspections while preserving historical data. Testnet explorer must show properly formatted CIP-68 tokens with all required fields populated and accessible via standard Cardano wallet interfaces.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Cardano testnet explorer links showing minted VCT tokens with complete metadata, GitHub repository containing smart contract code for CIP-68 minting, metadata schema documentation with JSON examples, IPFS links to stored inspection data, and transaction hashes proving successful L1 settlement from Hydra Head closure. At least 5 sample VCT tokens must be minted and viewable on testnet.

sub_fields.title: Delivery Month
sub_fields.description: The month when this milestone will be delivered

sub_fields.title: Cost
sub_fields.description: The cost of this milestone in ADA

sub_fields.title: Progress
sub_fields.description: Current status of the milestone

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Full Inspection Workflow MVP

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Complete end-to-end inspection workflow integrating all previous milestones into a functional MVP. Users will be able to upload vehicle photos through a web or mobile interface, trigger AI damage analysis, review AI-generated damage reports, submit inspections for multi-party approval, and receive minted VCT tokens. The workflow seamlessly integrates AI processing → Hydra Head state updates → CIP-68 token minting → QR code generation for easy token access. The QR code viewer will allow users to scan and instantly access their VCT metadata, inspection history, and vehicle condition reports. The system will demonstrate the complete value proposition: instant confirmations via Hydra with 99% cost reduction compared to L1-only approach.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: Users must be able to complete the entire inspection workflow through an intuitive UI without technical blockchain knowledge: upload photos, view AI analysis results in real-time, approve/reject findings, and receive a scannable QR code linking to their VCT token. Hydra state updates must provide sub-second confirmation feedback in the UI, demonstrating the speed advantage over L1 transactions. The system must handle concurrent inspection sessions without performance degradation. A comprehensive end-to-end video walkthrough must demonstrate the complete user journey from photo upload to VCT token receipt, including multi-party approval workflow and QR code scanning functionality.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Public video demonstration (5-10 minutes) showing complete inspection workflow with real vehicle photos, GitHub repository containing frontend code (React/Vue/Flutter), backend API integration, and QR code generation logic. The video must show actual Hydra confirmation times, AI analysis results, and final VCT minting on testnet. Additional evidence includes UI screenshots, user flow diagrams, and performance metrics showing sub-second Hydra confirmations.

sub_fields.title: Delivery Month

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Public Testnet Deployment

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Full public deployment of HydraAI Inspect on Cardano testnet with accessible endpoints for community testing. The public Hydra endpoint will allow external users to interact with the inspection system without running their own infrastructure. Public-facing frontend (web app and/or mobile app) will be deployed with user-friendly onboarding, sample vehicle images for testing, and clear instructions for the inspection workflow. Backend API will be publicly accessible with rate limiting and authentication for security. Comprehensive test instructions will guide community members through creating test inspections, understanding AI results, and minting VCT tokens. Landing page will showcase the project, provide documentation links, and explain the Hydra + AI + CIP-68 value proposition.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: Community members must be able to access the public application, create test accounts, upload sample vehicle images (or use provided test images), complete full inspection workflows, and receive minted VCT tokens on Cardano testnet without any technical setup. The system must successfully mint VCT tokens for all valid inspections with proper metadata and IPFS storage. A polished public video demo must be available showcasing the complete system capabilities, Hydra performance benefits, and real-world use case. GitHub repository must include comprehensive documentation covering architecture, API specifications, deployment instructions, troubleshooting guides, and contribution guidelines. Landing page must be live with project overview, team information, demo links, and clear call-to-action for community testing.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Public URLs for landing page and web application, Cardano testnet explorer links showing community-minted VCT tokens, GitHub repository with detailed README, API documentation, deployment guides, and contribution guidelines. Public video demo (YouTube/Vimeo) demonstrating system capabilities, community testing feedback summary, and analytics showing number of test inspections completed. Minimum 10 community-generated VCT tokens must be visible on testnet explorer.

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Community Testing & Final Report

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Comprehensive final project report documenting the complete HydraAI Inspect implementation, including technical achievements, performance metrics, lessons learned, and future roadmap. Community feedback summary will aggregate insights from beta testers, developers who explored the codebase, and Cardano community members who participated in testing. The report will include quantitative metrics (transaction counts, cost savings, performance benchmarks) and qualitative feedback (user experience, feature requests, bug reports). Code freeze with full open-source release under MIT license, including all repositories (frontend, backend, AI service, smart contracts, Hydra scripts), comprehensive documentation, deployment guides, and contribution guidelines for future developers.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer: The system must successfully process at least 50 real vehicle inspections from actual inspection centers (PT. Inspeksi Mobil Jogja or other partners), demonstrating production readiness and real-world applicability. Additionally, at least 300 simulated or testnet transactions must be completed to prove Hydra's high-throughput capabilities and cost efficiency compared to L1-only approach. GitHub repository must be production-ready with stable codebase, comprehensive documentation covering all components, clear installation and deployment instructions, API specifications, and active issue tracking. Final video demonstration must tell the compelling story of upgrading the existing CAR-dano production system to HydraAI Inspect, highlighting the before/after comparison, Hydra performance benefits, AI integration value, and real-world impact on inspection workflow efficiency.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer: Public final report (PDF/markdown) with detailed metrics, performance analysis, cost comparison (L1 vs Hydra), community feedback summary, and future development roadmap. GitHub repository with all source code, documentation, and MIT license. Cardano testnet explorer showing ≥300 transactions and ≥50 VCT tokens from real inspections. Final video demo (10-15 minutes) showcasing the complete project journey, technical achievements, and real-world deployment at inspection centers. Community testimonials and feedback compilation from at least 20 beta testers.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
Total Requested: ₳90,000



At current ADA price ($0.41 / Rp 6,800): ~$36,900 (Rp 612 million) for 6 months.



Budget Breakdown:

* 5 Engineers (Sumbu Labs): Full-stack, blockchain, AI, DevOps specialists

* 1 Operations & Business Support: HR, accounting, marketing, administrative coordination

* 2 Academic Advisors (UGM): Strategic guidance, research validation

* 50 Real Car Inspections: Proof of concept testing

* Infrastructure: Hydra nodes, testnet deployment, hosting



This is sole funding from Project Catalyst for the Hydra + AI upgrade.



Allocated across 6 milestones (details above)

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
Funding accelerates a system already generating real usage rather than creating a new prototype that may not achieve adoption.



This project delivers:



* First industrial Hydra reference implementation  

* AI+blockchain integration blueprint (reusable for any inspection use case)  

* Fully open-source code (MIT license)  

* Real testnet application with public access  

* High on-chain activity (50 real + 300 simulated inspections)  

* Academic validation (UGM professors)  

* Video demo proving concept before and after Hydra integration  



The outcome will be reusable for other industries:

* Insurance claim verification  

* Logistics quality control  

* Property inspection  

* Electronics grading  

* Any scenario requiring trusted, AI-assisted condition assessment
